page.title: 19THE BAPTIST CHURCH,VENTNOR.
page.content: The church was opened in 1875 in Mill Street, now called Pier Street. The cafe next door was the Manse. The church seats approx. 300 and in the summer there is a congregation of about 155 people. The Pastor is the Revd. Raymond Eveleigh and there are 35 active members of the church who come mainly from Ventnor, Wroxall, Bonchurch and St. Lawrence. The organist is Mr. Hollis. There are two services on a Sunday and Communion twice a month. The collection is about Â£130 a week. The church supports the Baptist Missionary Society, Leprosy Mission and Christian Radio work. The Sunday School meets on Sunday at 11 am. and has about 12 children. The church is heated by gas and has a hall and a number of other rooms attached to it.
